section.heading: Availability of quality incentive payments for covered oilseed producers

content.p: Subject to subsection (b) and the availability of appropriations under subsection (h), the Secretary shall use funds made available under subsection (h) to provide quality incentive payments for the production of oilseeds with specialized traits that enhance human health, as determined by the Secretary.

subsection.heading: Covered oilseeds
subsection.chapeau: The Secretary shall make payments under this section only for the production of an oilseed variety that has, as determined by the Secretary—

paragraph.chapeau: been demonstrated to improve the health profile of the oilseed for use in human consumption by—

subparagraph.content: reducing or eliminating the need to partially hydrogenate the oil derived from the oilseed for use in human consumption; or
adopting new technology traits; and

paragraph.content: 1 or more impediments to commercialization.

content.p: If funds are made available to carry out this section for a crop year, the Secretary shall issue a request for proposals for payments under this section.
A proponent may submit a multiyear proposal for payments under this section.

paragraph.heading: Content of proposals
paragraph.chapeau: A proposal for payments under this section shall include a description of—

subparagraph.content: how use of the oilseed enhances human health;
the impediments to commercial use of the oilseed;
each oilseed variety described in subsection (b) and the value of the oilseed variety as a matter of public policy;
a range for the base price and premiums per bushel or hundredweight to be paid to producers;
a per bushel or hundredweight amount of incentive payments requested for each year under this section that does not exceed ⅓ of the total premium offered for any year;
the period of time, not to exceed 4 years, during which incentive payments are to be provided to producers; and
the targeted total quantity of production and estimated acres needed to produce the targeted quantity for each year under this section.

content.p: The Secretary shall approve successful proposals submitted under subsection (c) on a timely basis.
The Secretary shall make payments to producers under this section after the Secretary receives documentation that the premium required under a contract has been paid to covered producers.

If funding provided for a crop year is not fully allocated under the initial request for proposals under subsection (c), the Secretary shall issue additional requests for proposals for subsequent crop years under this section.

If funding provided for a crop year is less than the amount otherwise approved by the Secretary or for which approval is sought, the Secretary shall prorate the payments or approvals in a manner determined by the Secretary so that the total payments do not exceed the funding level.
The Secretary shall protect proprietary information provided to the Secretary for the purpose of administering this section.

The proponent, if approved, shall be required to guarantee that the oilseed on which a payment is made by the Secretary under this section is used for human consumption as described in the proposal, as approved by the Secretary.

paragraph.heading: Noncompliance
paragraph.chapeau: If oilseeds on which a payment is made by the Secretary under this section are not actually used for the purpose the payment is made, the proponent shall be required to pay to the Secretary an amount equal to, as determined by the Secretary—

subparagraph.content: in the case of an inadvertent failure, twice the amount of the payment made by the Secretary under this section to the producer of the oilseeds; and
in any other case, up to twice the full value of the oilseeds involved.

content.p: The Secretary may require such assurances and documentation as may be needed to enforce the guarantee.

In addition to payments required under paragraph (2), the Secretary may impose penalties on additional persons that use oilseeds the use of which is restricted under this section for a purpose other than the intended use.

subparagraph.heading: Amount
subparagraph.chapeau: The amount of a penalty under this paragraph shall—

clause.content: be in an amount determined appropriated by the Secretary; but
not to exceed twice the full value of the oilseeds.

content.p: There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as are necessary to carry out this section for each of fiscal years 2009 through 2012.
The provisions of section 590h(g) of title 16, relating to assignment of payments, shall apply to payments made under this chapter.
The producer making the assignment, or the assignee, shall provide the Secretary with notice, in such manner as the Secretary may require, of any assignment made under this section.

As soon as practicable after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary may track the benefits provided, directly or indirectly, to individuals and entities under titles I and II and the amendments made by those titles.

section.heading: Prevention of deceased individuals receiving payments under farm commodity programs

subsection.heading: Regulations
subsection.chapeau: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall promulgate regulations that—

paragraph.content: describe the circumstances under which, in order to allow for the settlement of estates and for related purposes, payments may be issued in the name of a deceased individual; and
preclude the issuance of payments to, and on behalf of, deceased individuals that were not eligible for the payments.

content.p: At least twice each year, the Secretary shall reconcile the social security numbers of all individuals who receive payments under this chapter, whether directly or indirectly, with the Social Security Administration to determine if the individuals are alive.

subsection.heading: Definitions
subsection.chapeau: In this section:

paragraph.heading: Eligible hard white wheat seed
paragraph.chapeau: The term “eligible hard white wheat seed” means hard white wheat seed that, as determined by the Secretary, is—

subparagraph.content: certified;
of a variety that is suitable for the State in which the seed will be planted;
rated at least superior with respect to quality; and
specifically approved under a seed establishment program established by the State Department of Agriculture and the State Wheat Commission of the 1 or more States in which the seed will be planted.

content.p: The term “program” means the hard white wheat development program established under subsection (b)(1).

The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of Agriculture, in consultation with the State Departments of Agriculture and the State Wheat Commissions of the States in regions in which hard white wheat is produced, as determined by the Secretary.

Subject to the availability of appropriations, the Secretary shall establish a hard white wheat development program in accordance with paragraph (2) to promote the establishment of hard white wheat as a viable market class of wheat in the United States by encouraging production of at least 240,000,000 bushels of hard white wheat by 2012.

Subject to subparagraphs (B) and (C) and subsection (c), if funds are made available for any of the 2009 through 2012 crops of hard white wheat, the Secretary shall make available incentive payments to producers of those crops.

The Secretary shall carry out subparagraph (A) subject to a regional limitation determined by the Secretary on the number of acres for which payments may be received that takes into account planting history and potential planting, but does not exceed a total of 2,900,000 acres or the equivalent volume of production based on a yield of 50 bushels per acre.

subparagraph.heading: Payment limitations
subparagraph.chapeau: Payments to producers on a farm described in subparagraph (A) shall be—

clause.content: in an amount that is not less than $0.20 per bushel; and
in an amount that is not less than $2.00 per acre for planting eligible hard white wheat seed.

content.p: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $35,000,000 for the period of fiscal years 2009 through 2012.

Subject to the availability of funds under subsection (c), the Secretary shall provide compensation to producers of durum wheat in an amount not to exceed 50 percent of the actual cost of fungicides applied to a crop of durum wheat of the producers to control Fusarium head blight (wheat scab) on acres certified to have been planted to Durum wheat in a crop year.

If the total amount of funds appropriated for a fiscal year under subsection (c) are insufficient to fulfill all eligible requests for compensation under this section, the Secretary shall prorate the compensation payments in a manner determined by the Secretary to be equitable.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 through 2012.

As soon as practicable after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall establish a storage facility loan program to provide funds for producers of grains, oilseeds, pulse crops, hay, renewable biomass, and other storable commodities (other than sugar), as determined by the Secretary, to construct or upgrade storage and handling facilities for the commodities.

subsection.heading: Eligible producers
subsection.chapeau: A storage facility loan under this section shall be made available to any producer described in subsection (a) that, as determined by the Secretary—

paragraph.content: has a satisfactory credit history;
has a need for increased storage capacity; and
demonstrates an ability to repay the loan.

content.p: A storage facility loan under this section shall have a maximum term of 12 years.
The maximum principal amount of a storage facility loan under this section shall be $500,000.

The Secretary shall provide for 1 partial disbursement of loan principal and 1 final disbursement of loan principal, as determined to be appropriate and subject to acceptable documentation, to facilitate the purchase and construction of eligible facilities.

subsection.heading: Loan security
subsection.chapeau: Approval of a storage facility loan under this section shall—

paragraph.chapeau: require the borrower to provide loan security to the Secretary, in the form of—

subparagraph.content: a lien on the real estate parcel on which the storage facility is located; or
such other security as is acceptable to the Secretary;

paragraph.chapeau: under such rules and regulations as the Secretary may prescribe, not require a severance agreement from the holder of any prior lien on the real estate parcel on which the storage facility is located, if the borrower—

subparagraph.content: agrees to increase the down payment on the storage facility by an amount determined appropriate by the Secretary; or
provides other security acceptable to the Secretary; and

paragraph.chapeau: allow a borrower, upon the approval of the Secretary, to define a subparcel of real estate as security for the storage facility loan if the subparcel is—

subparagraph.content: of adequate size and value to adequately secure the loan; and
not subject to any other liens or mortgages that are superior to the lien interest of the Commodity Credit Corporation.

content.p: In carrying out this title and title II and amendments made by those titles, if the Secretary approves a document, the Secretary shall not subsequently determine the document is inadequate or invalid because of the lack of authority of any person signing the document on behalf of the applicant or any other individual, entity, general partnership, or joint venture, or the documents relied upon were determined inadequate or invalid, unless the person signing the program document knowingly and willfully falsified the evidence of signature authority or a signature.
Nothing in this section prohibits the Secretary from asking a proper party to affirm any document that otherwise would be considered approved under subsection (a).

paragraph.heading: No retroactive effect
paragraph.chapeau: A denial of benefits based on a lack of affirmation under paragraph (1) shall not be retroactive with respect to third-party producers who were not the subject of the erroneous representation of authority, if the third-party producers—

subparagraph.content: relied on the prior approval by the Secretary of the documents in good faith; and
substantively complied with all program requirements 1

content.p: The Secretary shall ensure that all the geospatial data of the agencies of the Department of Agriculture are portable and standardized.
In this subsection, the term “agricultural operation” includes the production and marketing of agricultural commodities and livestock.

paragraph.heading: Prohibition
paragraph.chapeau: Except as provided in paragraphs (3) and (4), the Secretary, any officer or employee of the Department of Agriculture, or any contractor or cooperator of the Department, shall not disclose—

subparagraph.content: information provided by an agricultural producer or owner of agricultural land concerning the agricultural operation, farming or conservation practices, or the land itself, in order to participate in programs of the Department; or
geospatial information otherwise maintained by the Secretary about agricultural land or operations for which information described in subparagraph (A) is provided.

subparagraph.heading: Limited release of information
subparagraph.chapeau: If the Secretary determines that the information described in paragraph (2) will not be subsequently disclosed except in accordance with paragraph (4), the Secretary may release or disclose the information to a person or Federal, State, local, or tribal agency working in cooperation with the Secretary in any Department program—

clause.content: when providing technical or financial assistance with respect to the agricultural operation, agricultural land, or farming or conservation practices; or

when responding to a disease or pest threat to agricultural operations, if the Secretary determines that a threat to agricultural operations exists and the disclosure of information to a person or cooperating government entity is necessary to assist the Secretary in responding to the disease or pest threat as authorized by law.

paragraph.heading: Exceptions
paragraph.chapeau: Nothing in this subsection affects—

subparagraph.content: the disclosure of payment information (including payment information and the names and addresses of recipients of payments) under any Department program that is otherwise authorized by law;

subparagraph.chapeau: the disclosure of information described in paragraph (2) if the information has been transformed into a statistical or aggregate form without naming any—

clause.content: individual owner, operator, or producer; or
specific data gathering site; or

subparagraph.content: the disclosure of information described in paragraph (2) pursuant to the consent of the agricultural producer or owner of agricultural land.

content.p: The participation of the agricultural producer or owner of agricultural land in, or receipt of any benefit under, any program administered by the Secretary may not be conditioned on the consent of the agricultural producer or owner of agricultural land under paragraph (4)(C).
The disclosure of information under paragraph (2) shall not constitute a waiver of any applicable privilege or protection under Federal law, including trade secret protection.

subsection.heading: Definitions
subsection.chapeau: In this section:

content.p: The term “agricultural commodity” has the meaning given the term in section 5602 of this title.

The term “geographically disadvantaged farmer or rancher” has the meaning given the term in section 10906(a) of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 (7 U.S.C. 2204 note; Public Law 107–171).

Subject to the availability of funds under subsection (d), the Secretary may provide geographically disadvantaged farmers or ranchers direct reimbursement payments for activities described in subsection (c).

Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), the Secretary may provide direct reimbursement payments to a geographically disadvantaged farmer or rancher to transport an agricultural commodity, or inputs used to produce an agricultural commodity, during a fiscal year.

To be eligible to receive assistance under paragraph (1), a geographically disadvantaged farmer or rancher shall demonstrate to the Secretary that transportation of the agricultural commodity or inputs occurred over a distance of more than 30 miles, as determined by the Secretary.

subparagraph.heading: In general
subparagraph.chapeau: Subject to paragraph (2), the amount of direct reimbursement payments made to a geographically disadvantaged farmer or rancher under this section for a fiscal year shall equal the product obtained by multiplying—

clause.content: the amount of costs incurred by the geographically disadvantaged farmer or rancher for transportation of the agricultural commodity or inputs during the fiscal year; and

subclause.content: the percentage of the allowance for that fiscal year under section 5941 of title 5 for Federal employees stationed in Alaska and Hawaii; or
in the case of an insular area (as defined in section 3103 of this title), a comparable percentage of the allowance for the fiscal year, as determined by the Secretary.

content.p: The total amount of direct reimbursement payments provided by the Secretary under this section shall not exceed $15,000,000 for a fiscal year.
There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as are necessary to carry out this section for fiscal year 2009 and each succeeding fiscal year.
The Secretary shall make available to the Farm Service Agency to carry out this chapter $50,000,000.
